intro: Tetracera volubilis subsp. mollis, commonly known as the soft-stemmed tetracera, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
